discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
See link: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/dual-write/errors-and-alerts:

Alert notifications
As an admin, you can create one or more alert settings to handle cases of planned or unplanned maintenance. For example, you can set up the dual-write system to notify you by email if a specific error threshold is reached because of, for example, network errors. The dual-write system can also take action on your behalf. For example, it can pause or stop dual-write.

Selected Answer: B
Use catch-up errors: This is the correct option. Catch-up errors functionality allows you to reprocess errors and recover from a synchronization interruption. It helps to catch up on missed changes and ensures that the data is synchronized correctly.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/dual-write/dual-write-troubleshooting-live-sync

Selected Answer: A
“Re-run execution” is a feature in Dynamics 365 dual-write that retries the entire execution, along with the records that failed or errored out in the last sync1. However, this feature is typically used when you encounter issues while copying pre-existing data between finance and operations apps and Dataverse1. In the scenario you described, the issue was due to an unplanned maintenance window, not a sync issue. Therefore, enabling alert conditions would be more effective in preventing data loss and errors during such interruptions1.

Selected Answer: A
Answer should be A. The question is about preventing loss of requests in future. Alert notifications can handle cases of planned or unplanned maintenance. Based on alert settings dual-write system can take action on your behalf. For example, it can pause or stop dual-write. If one of the apps becomes unavailable and, based on thresholds defined for alert, dual-write goes into a paused state, all new requests are queued (that is, they aren't lost). After both apps are running smoothly, you can resume from the paused state. The updates will then be read back from the queue and written to the recovered app.
whats the correct answer here?

Selected Answer: A
As an admin, you can create one or more alert settings to handle cases of planned or unplanned maintenance. For example, you can set up the dual-write system to notify you by email if a specific error threshold is reached because of, for example, network errors. The dual-write system can also take action on your behalf. For example, it can pause or stop dual-write.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/dual-write/errors-and-alerts

B. Use catch-up errors. Explanation: "Catch-up errors" is a feature in Dual-Write that helps to handle errors and ensure data consistency during synchronization. When an interruption occurs, catch-up errors can be used to identify and reprocess the failed data synchronization. This helps in recovering from the interruption and bringing the systems back into sync without data loss.

The “re-run execution” option is not limited to the initial synchronization process only. It can be used for any failed synchronization requests or operations, regardless of whether they are part of the initial sync or subsequent sync attempts.

When errors occur during synchronization, selecting the “re-run execution” option allows you to retry those specific failed requests or operations. This option is designed to address individual errors and ensure that the affected data is successfully synchronized.

Therefore, if you encounter synchronization errors during the unplanned maintenance window, selecting the “re-run execution” option can help you retry and synchronize the missed data, reducing the chances of data loss and ensuring data consistency between Dynamics 365 Sales and Dynamics 365 Finance.

Also think A is correct

The dual-write system can also take action on your behalf. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/dual-write/errors-and-alerts

Should be A.

questions.question_text:
A company is using dual-write to synchronize customer data between Dynamics 365 Sales and Dynamics 365 Finance.
During an unplanned maintenance window for Dynamics 365 Finance, synchronization of customer data was interrupted. The interruption caused multiple errors and a loss of new requests.
You need to prevent errors and data loss from recurring.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Upgrade the existing on-premises environment to Dynamics AX 2012 R2. This is a correct answer because upgrading to Dynamics AX 2012 R2 is a prerequisite for migrating to Dynamics 365 Finance. You cannot migrate directly from Dynamics AX 2009 to Dynamics 365 Finance, because there are significant changes in the data model and the application architecture. You must first upgrade to Dynamics AX 2012 R2, and then use the Data migration tool (DMT) to migrate your data to Dynamics 365 Finance.

'Using the DMT is the only supported upgrade path from AX 2009. The DMT helps you find and fill gaps between the table schemas for each version, as well as helping you move your data.'
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/data-migration-tool

So neither of these are the correct answer, albeit I'd argue that A is the least wrong.

Selected Answer: C
This question is identical to Topic 1 Question 32 but in that case the only common answer is to upgrade to AX 2012 R2. I'm kinda guessing here but perhaps this route was the only available one at the point of the question being published. Now data migration can be performed directly from AX 2009.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/migration-upgrade/data-migration-tool

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text:
You plan the migration from Dynamics AX 2012 R3 to a Dynamics 365 Finance environment.
You will be using Lifecycle Services (LCS) and the tools provided with it.
You need to clean up data, review and configure SQL optimizations, and identify deprecated features in your code.
What tool should you use?

HOTSPOT -
You manage a Dynamics 365 Finance environment.
In preparation for being migrated into a new environment, data packages are being numbered in alignment with the default numbering formats in Lifecycle
Services. A package is named 03.01.002.
You need to identify what this package contains. To answer, select the appropriate option in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Image of table proving correct answer:

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lcs-solutions/media/pdp_08.png

The data packages that Microsoft publishes on LCS use a numbering sequence that is based on the module, data type, and sequence.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lcs-solutions/process-data-packages-lcs-solutions
Correct (1. Data Type 2. Number Seq 3. Module)
Correct
